category.name: Linked U
category.caption: linked <u>U</u>nit
category.title: one or more scenes linked by a linker or autonomous

category.name: Linker
category.caption: <u>L</u>inker
category.title: a relation between two or more scenes. If one of the scenes is unspecified, it may apply to a single scene.

category.name: Ground
category.caption: <u>G</u>round
category.title: a relation between the scene it is situated in and the ground (i.e., the speech event; either the speaker, the hearer or the general context in which the text was uttered/written/conceived)

category.name: State
category.caption: <u>S</u>tate
category.title: main relation in a static scene with its auxilliaries, modals and secondary verbs

category.name: Process
category.caption: <u>P</u>rocess
category.title: main relation in a dynamic scene (a scene that evolves in time). includes all its auxilliaries, modals and secondary verbs

category.caption: a<u>D</u>verbial
category.name: aDverbial
category.title: adds more information about the scene; not a participant, but a relation

category.name: Center
category.caption: <u>C</u>enter
category.title: an entity comprising a complex unit (the relations in the complex units are either E or N)

category.name: Elaborator
category.caption: <u>E</u>laborator
category.title: a relation applied to a single entity (C) to form a complex unit

category.name: Connector
category.caption: co<u>N</u>nector
category.title: a relation applied to two or more entities (Cs) to form a complex unit

category.caption: <u>R</u>ole Marker
category.name: Role Marker
category.title: Determines the role of a C in its super-ordinate relation

category.name: WH-Adverbial
category.caption: WH-A<u>D</u>verbial
category.title: adds more information about the scene; not a participant, but a relation
